content: fairytale pumpkins construction finished measurements they are knit in the round on dpns from the height & width 2 /5cm bottom to the top pumpkin is stuffed the cast yarn off end is used to help shape the pumpkin and the cast on end is used to close up bottom end i used paton s classic worsted but they also look nice in sock/fingering abbreviations needles k = knit k2tog = knit 2 together decreases 1 stitch one set of double-pointed needles dpns in size k3tog = knit 3 together decreasing 2 stitches us 2 2 75mm or desired size kfb = knit front and back 1 st increase notes kfbf = knit front back and front 2 st increase if your hands get sore with the recommended p = purl gauge try using sock or fingering and going up a ssk = slip 2 stitches knit-wise one at a time to few needle sizes your right needle then return the now- turned how to video on how to kfbf into a stitch stitches back to the left needle knit them both how to video on how to do a running stitch together through the back loop decreasing 1 st s = stitch es supplies small amount of stuffing copyright 2025 by natasha hanson all rights reserved 1 instructions using your pumpkin color cast on 10 sts leaving a long tail for closing the bottom hole in finishing divide the stitches over 2 dpns and join to work in the round round 1 knit round 2 kfb k1 kfb k1 kfb repeat 16 sts redistribute the sts on to 3 dpns needle 1 now has 4 sts and needle 2 & 3 now have 6 sts each round 3 k1 kfb repeat until end of round 24 sts round 4 k2 kfbf repeat until end of round 40 sts stitch count check in needle 1 should have 10 sts needle 2 & 3 should have 15 stitches each round 5-11 k3 p2 repeat until end of round round 12 k3tog k2 repeat until end of round 24 sts round 13 k1 k2tog repeat until end of round 16 sts redistribute the sts on to 2 dpns needle 1 & 2 now both have 8 sts each stuff your pumpkin round 14 k1 k2tog k2tog k2tog k1 repeat 10 sts round 15 ssk k1 k2tog repeat 6 sts cut yarn change to stem color round 16-20 knit cut yarn draw thread through remaining 6 sts pull tight and secure do not weave in end as you will need it in the finishing finishing shaping your pumpkin and helping it lay flat first insert your cast off end down into your pumpkin stem see figure a and out through the bottom hole your cast off end should now be hanging out the bottom hole second pull downward on your cast off end pulling the stem inward not too much the point of this is to help the bottom lay flat so stop
